isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Case-to-Head Tubes

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, it is recommended that the case-to-head tubes be replaced each time they are removed. The D-rings are not replaceable. If you reuse the case-to-head tubes, you assume the risk for leakage. You must inspect each D-ring carefully for evidence of cutting, abrasion or twisting and never reuse a tube exhibiting any of these seal conditions.

note.para: If D-rings appear to be damaged, you must replace the entire case-to-head tube assembly with a new one. D-rings are not available independently.

step1.para: Lubricate the D-rings on the case-to-head tube assembly with clean engine oil and install through oil rail and into the branch tube.

note.para: Oil rail must be completely torqued prior to installing case-to-head tube.

step1.para: Torque case-to-head tube assembly to the Special Torque.
